title: Govt. brings cybercrime centre I4C under PMLA
content: In a notification dated April 25, the Revenue Department under the Finance Ministry included I4C under Section 66 of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

title: Dalai Lama may decide on a spiritual successor 90th birthday events in July: Central Tibetan Administration leader Penpa Tsering
content: Central Tibetan Administration leader recalls Dalai Lama’s 2011 statement that he will consult religious heads of various Buddhist traditions before taking a call; the Sikyong says he hopes for Indian government representation at the celebration to mark the beginning of the ‘Year of Compassion’

title: ‘Private participation will help State make optimal use of National Waterway III’
content: New norms that open up the country’s inland water transport sector to private players are likely to help attract investments in infrastructure development in the sector, say stakeholders

title: Telangana Prisons dept. tightens the bars with security, tech and staff audit
content: Covers central prisons, district jails, special prisons for women, special sub-jails, sub-jails in State with focus on scanner functionality, search procedure, visitor ID verification, entry record maintenance

title: SC verdict on actions of Governor a victory for States’ rights, says T.N. Chief Minister Stalin
content: At an event held on Sunday, he felicitated former Attorney General of India Mukul Rohatgi and senior advocates of the Supreme Court Abhishek Singhvi, Rakesh Dwivedi, and P. Wilson, whose arguments won the case on Centre-State relations

title: Outsourcing non-core works helps Kochi metro reduce operational cost
content: The comprehensive strategy includes focusing on outsourcing non-core work, embracing digital systems, and leveraging solar energy

title: Skirmishes continue at LoC as India weighs response to Pahalgam attack
content: Naval vessels carry out multiple anti-ship firings to revalidate and demonstrate readiness of platforms, systems and crew for long-range precision offensive strike.

title: Dr. Satish Kumar is new Pro- Vice Chancellor of SRM University-AP
content: Dr. Satish Kumar completed his post-graduation from Andhra University and received his Ph. D from Punjab University. He then pursued a Master’s in Management at the McGill University, Canada

title: Union Minister Kishan Reddy unveils book authored by State Health Minister Satya Kumar
content: A compilation of 89 articles the Minister has written for a Telugu daily, the book  will be available on Amazon from April 28

title: Bihar election: Eye on votes, Union Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal takes part in Dalit Mahapanchayat
content: Top leaders of the Bihar BJP roundly attacked Congress party alleging that party ruled for 65 with the slogan of Garibi Hatao but poor people were never their priority

title: Smoking is a major risk factor for rheumatoid arthritis
content: Speaking at a webinar on “Understanding Arthritis”, they pointed out that smoking is a strong risk factor for rheumatoid arthritis and advocated lifestyle changes, exercises, yoga, and a healthy diet that is low on carbohydrate and sugar but rich in fibre and protein

title: 537 Pakistanis leave via Attari; no order to extend deadline, say officials
content: A government official said that exemption may be granted on grounds of extreme compassion in some cases; 850 people from Pakistan have arrived in India since April 24

title: NIV shares H5N1 genome data in a public database
content: The institute has shared the genome sequence data with the Global Initiative on Sharing All Influenza Data, on April 21, a day aftera report was published in The Hindu about NIV not sharing sequence data before paper publication

title: Bengaluru: Giant cut-outs, flexes dot Govindraj Nagar roads on MLA’s birthday despite ban
content: Large life-sized images of the MLA were painted on public walls, while flexes lined key roads in the locality. Many residents called the displays an eyesore and questioned the blatant violation of civic rules.

title: New heads for govt. medical colleges, teaching hospitals in A.P.
content: AP government appoints new principals for GMCs and superintendents for teaching hospitals, after recent promotion of eight professors to ADME rank

title: Every citizen should take pride in capital Amaravati, says Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: The relaunch of the capital construction works by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on May 2 will mark a major turning point in the State’s history, he says

title: Karni Sena attacks SP MP’s convoy; ‘deadly act’ says Akhilesh Yadav
content: Police suspend local outpost in-charge and beat constable; Akhilesh slams U.P. government, says BJP will ‘fall prey to violent elements’

title: Senthilbalaji, Ponmudy resign as Tamil Nadu Ministers after strong remarks from courts
content: Stalin recommends Governor to accept resignations of Ponmudy, Senthilbalaji; Mano Thangaraj to be inducted into Cabinet

title: Job fairs will continue, says Minister Rajan
content: So far, the job fair has seen 1,246 candidates receiving job offers—with 613 recruited via online interviews and 633 through the on-ground fair

title: K-CIS completes 25,000 inspections
content: The success of K-CIS is an example of how quickly the Industries department is being professionally remoulded, says Kerala Industries and Law Minister

title: Bihar’s new bounce
content: SepakTakraw, originally from Malaysia, and known informally as kick volleyball in India, is now one of Bihar’s 14 priority sports. A mixture of football, volleyball, and a few other sports, it came into the limelight with the world cup being held in Patna towards the end of March. Amit Bhelari traces its growing popularity in Bihar

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Opposition parties may seek special session of Parliament
content: Congress is reaching out to other allies in the INDIA bloc to frame a consensus. “It is under consideration,” a senior Congress leader said.

title: Congress is villain No. 1 of Telangana, says KCR at BRS’ silver jubilee meet
content: The BRS supremo and former chief minister alleges that Congress government has ruined the State’s economy due to lack of experience, its inefficiency

title: A musical journey through the life of Raja Ravi Varma
content: Kilimanoor Palace to release a musical album on Ravi Varma on the occasion of his 177th birth anniversary

title: Panel on simultaneous polls to seek film personalities’ view on proposed legislation
content: During their two-day stay at Mumbai in May, the JPC members will also be meeting officials from the RBI, SBI, other banks, and the officials of the Maharashtra State Election Commission

title: Agricultural agenda must move from food security to farmer prosperity: Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar
content: He calls for empowering farmers by creating awareness and by informing them that the government cooperative system was very robust

title: Congress leader from Alur in Kurnool district murdered in Guntakal
content: Assailants hit Lakshminarayana’s car with a tipper and hacked him to death with hunting sickles, say police

title: Panels to monitor adherence to annual pokkali rice and fish cycle
content: The move comes in the wake of complaints from farmers that the coastal paddy fields have not yet been drained in preparation for sowing ahead of the rainy season

title: VAC signals require 6% to 17% manual interference to accommodate Bengaluru traffic
content: According to BTP officials, on average, while these systems run on an automated mode about 94% of the time (in a day), during the remaining 6% (majorly during the evening peak hours) they must be manually operated.

title: Rayala Sports Complex inaugurated in Kurnool
content: District Principal and Sessions Judge G. Kabarthi expresses happiness over the establishment of the complex and asks sports enthusiasts to make use of the facility as it would serve as a good opportunity to hone their skills

title: Delta region’s only coconut marketing complex in Pattukottai remains idle
content: The facility Ponnvarayankadu, built in 2011 at an estimate of ₹8 crore and renovated in 2022, remains non-functional; officials say they plan to hold meeting with farmers

title: Residents oppose felling of 368 trees for commercial project at Cantonment Railway Colony
content: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has issued a public notice inviting objections to the proposed felling of 368 trees located inside the Bangalore Cantonment Railway Colony at Vasanth Nagar.

title: Tamil Nadu government’s financial aid to power utility has risen by around 300% in 10 years
content: A huge financial outgo from the State government to the power utility is one of the key factors for its continued relatively-high revenue and fiscal deficits

title: Members of banned Jamaat-e-Islami launch new political party in J&K
content: People feel that their real representatives are not on the ground and the Justice and Development Front (JDF) has been launched to fill that void, says party general secretary Sayar Reshi. The party’s founding principles are justice, development and public welfare, he says

title: War should be the nation’s last resort, says Siddaramaiah after his statement draws criticism
content: ‘I did not say war against Pakistan is not necessary. What I said was that we are ready for war if needed. War should always be a nation’s last resort-never the first nor the only option’

title: Environmentalist defend conocarpus plant, slam ‘unscientific attack’
content: Originating in Yemen, the Conocarpus plant is now widely grown in countries like Dubai, Kuwait, and Abu Dhabi, contributing to 70 percent of their green cover

title: Thiruvananthapuram airport, railway station receive hoax bomb threats
content: The police swiftly responded with precautionary measures, though operations at both prominent transit hubs remained unaffected

title: Union Minister exhorts States to contribute to achieving energy consumption target
content: State Designated Agencies urged to adopt Energy Conservation and Sustainable Building Code for commercial buildings, and Eco Niwas Samhita for residential buildings

title: As mercury level goes up, price of tender coconut skyrockets in Bengaluru
content: Tender coconut growers also cite declining yield and changing environmental conditions for the shortage in supply eventually leading to soaring prices.

title: Applications invited for higher secondary teacher transfer for 2025-26
content: Government wants to complete transfers by the end of May to facilitate joining of teachers in their new schools before June 1

title: Vizag police bust nine-member gang allegedly involved in loan app fraud, seize ₹60 lakh worth cryptocurrency
content: The prime accused in the case has confessed that he has been lured into committing the crime by two Chinese cybercriminals, says Commissioner of Police Shankabratha Bagchi

title: Nellore police bust seven-member cybercriminal gang
content: Chinna Bazar police officials arrest five persons from Rajasthan and two locals, who duped a woman of ₹2.46 crore in online investment scam

title: Disproportionate assets case: Satheesan demands K.M. Abraham’s resignation
content: He asks the CM to halt the “extravagant” celebrations being held to mark the fourth anniversary of the LDF government

title: Gadkari and Kishan Reddy to launch national highway projects worth ₹5,413 crore in Telangana on May 5
content: Cost of construction is pegged at about ₹13,000 crore and 50% of land acquisition cost is estimated at about ₹2,230 crore

title: Yatnal accuses Siddaramaiah of speaking as Pakistan agent over Pahalgam terror attack
content: Being a Chief Minister and an Indian citizen, he does not have any shame in making such a shabby remark, says the Vijayapura MLA

title: More houses demolished in J&K; man killed by gunmen in Kupwara
content: Indian and Pakistani troops exchange small arms fire; on demolitions, J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah says “don’t let innocent people become collateral damage”

title: LSGD issues guidelines to ensure quality and regular supply of inoculum for biodegradable waste processing
content: Lack of availability of inoculum at regular intervals and of proper quality has been a problem faced by those who adopted these methods

title: Three-member gang arrested for multiple burglaries across 9 districts
content: The police recovered 400 grams of gold ornaments, 500 grams of silver ornaments, and six cell phones

title: Former MLA urges State and Centre to renew FRCA of RDT
content: The services of RTD, which works for the upliftment of the poor, are not just limited to Anantapur, but extend across Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, says YSRCP leader

title: Andhra Pradesh High Court calls for data pertaining to ‘sewer deaths’ from 1993
content: The aim is to compensate the families of all those who have died under such situations in all the municipal corporations, municipalities and local bodies, the court observes, and posts the matter for further hearing to July 16

title: NIOS-passed candidate eligible for admission to law degree courses: HC
content: Justice N. Nagaresh made the observation recently while quashing an order of the Principal of S.N. Law College, Poothotta, Thripunithura

title: Son of Falcons coordinator behind Sanders prank
content: The son of Falcons defensive coordinator Jeff Ulbrich admitted to being the one behind a prank call to Shedeur Sanders during Day 2 of the NFL draft.

title: Officials admit error with Knicks-Pistons ending
content: New York's Karl-Anthony Towns made a go-ahead 3-pointer with 46.6 seconds left, and officials said they missed a foul on a game-winning attempt by Detroit's Tim Hardaway Jr. at the buzzer.

title: Liverpool clinches EPL title, ties Man Utd record
content: Liverpool have been crowned Premier League champions after a 5-1 win over Tottenham on Sunday, securing their 20th league title.

title: Duke big man Maluach enters draft at deadline
content: Duke big man Khaman Maluach is jumping to the NBA, where he is a potential top-10 pick after helping the Blue Devils reach the Final Four.

title: Jets' Hellebuyck allows five goals, pulled again
content: Two-time Vezina Trophy winner Connor Hellebuyck allowed five goals before being pulled early in the third period as the top-seeded Winnipeg Jets fell to the St. Louis Blues 5-1 on Sunday.

title: Source: Ancelotti, Pérez to hold Madrid exit talks
content: Carlo Ancelotti will meet with Real Madrid president Florentino Pérez in the coming days to discuss the coach's departure from the club, a source told ESPN.

title: Williams out as Yanks' closer; Weaver to get a shot
content: Devin Williams, who has stumbled to start the season, has been ousted as closer by Yankees manager Aaron Boone, with Luke Weaver set to get save opportunities.

title: Mets minor leaguer Gomez fires 104.5 mph pitch
content: Raimon Gomez, a pitcher for the Mets' Class A affiliate in Post St. Lucie, Florida, had a pitch clocked at 104.5 mph -- faster than any pitch thrown in the majors this year.

title: 'There's no drop-off down there': How the bottom of the order is powering the Cubs' offense to top of MLB
content: Chicago has scored more runs than any team in the majors so far -- with the help of some unexpected sluggers.

title: Liverpool waited 35 years for this party as Premier League champions, and they earned it
content: Liverpool waited 30 years and then won the Premier League during a pandemic. Now they've won again, and they can finally celebrate.

title: Even Man City's worst could result in an FA Cup trophy
content: Man City won't declare success, but they can still win an FA Cup and a spot in next season's Champions League.

title: Browns gamble on Shedeur Sanders after drafting Dillon Gabriel: What's the plan?
content: Answering the biggest questions surrounding Cleveland's selection of Sanders in the fifth round, including reaction from around the league.

title: Wrexham's latest promotion is a miracle. The next will be even harder
content: Wrexham's third straight promotion has them on the Premier League's doorstep. Getting there will be much harder.

title: Slot sings to Klopp after Liverpool clinch PL title
content: Arne Slot sang Jürgen Klopp's name on the pitch at Anfield as Liverpool celebrated their Premier League title win.

title: Arsenal comeback over Lyon 'unexplainable' - boss
content: Arsenal reached their first Women's Champions League final in 18 years on Sunday, taking down French powerhouse Lyon with a remarkable 4-1 away win.

title: Wrexham plan 'no superstars' policy - Parkinson
content: Wrexham will operate a "no superstars and no egos" policy when they target new signings for their Premier League push next season.

title: Pep: City 'machine' not good despite FA Cup final
content: Pep Guardiola said reaching the FA Cup final doesn't come close to making up for Manchester City's poor season.

title: Amorim: PL history shows Man Utd can be restored
content: Ruben Amorim has told beleaguered Manchester United fans to take comfort from Premier League history as they seek to close the gap on champions-in-waiting Liverpool.

title: Salah passes Aguero as PL's top foreign scorer
content: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah is now the Premier League's top-scoring foreign player after surpassing Manchester City legend Sergio Aguero with his strike against Tottenham Hotspur on Sunday.

title: Inter's Serie A title hopes dented by Roma loss
content: Inter Milan's Serie A title hopes took a massive blow when the defending champions suffered a 1-0 home loss to Roma on Sunday.

title: 'He's a great leader': Cam Ward displays leadership abilities in texts to Titans draftees
content: The No. 1 pick in the 2025 NFL draft wasted no time building a rapport with his fellow Titans rookies.

title: Eubank Jr. should focus on Canelo, rather than Benn rematch
content: Forget a rematch with Conor Benn, the focus for Chris Eubank Jr should now fully be on Canelo Alvarez

title: The biggest question facing every WNBA team when training camp opens Sunday
content: Who will carry Phoenix into its new era? What will Reese and Cardoso do in Year 2? Are the Fever title contenders?

title: 2025 NFL draft: Fantasy football analysis of Rounds 1-3
content: Liz Loza, Matt Bowen and Mike Clay break down the fantasy potential of early-round rookies from the NFL draft and provide initial 2025 projections.

title: Should you draft Caitlin Clark or A'ja Wilson at No. 1?
content: A'ja Wilson opened as the top ranked player in fantasy women's basketball entering the 2025 season, but does someone else have a case to supplant Wilson in 2025?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye Atlético's Álvarez to replace Lewandowski
content: Barcelona have identified Atlético Madrid's Julián Álvarez as Robert Lewandowski's successor. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: In Uttar Pradesh, Aadhaar touts clone 'deputy CM'
content: A sting operation near the Uttar Pradesh Assembly in Lucknow exposed a thriving tout racket at an Aadhaar Seva Kendra. Touts, in collusion with staff from Smart Chip Private Limited, fabricated identities for a fee. UIDAI officials confirmed the irregularities after their own investigation and have initiated further probes and filed an FIR.

title: 12 killed as van hits biker, plunges into well in Madhya Pradesh
content: In Madhya Pradesh's Mandsaur district, a tragic accident occurred when a van, heading to Aantari Mata Temple, collided with a bike, killing the biker. The van then plunged into a well, resulting in the death of ten passengers. A local villager died while rescuing passengers from the toxic well, and four others sustained critical injuries.

title: Bharat Mata Ki Jai drowns Pakistan Zindabad in London protest after J&K attack
content: Hundreds of Indian-origin supporters overwhelmed a smaller Pakistani protest outside the Indian High Commission in London following the Pahalgam terrorist attack. The Indian side, displaying the Tricolour and chanting patriotic slogans, outnumbered the Pakistani protesters who were raising slogans against PM Modi. The incident has sparked debate in the UK, with right-wing commentators questioning the success of multiculturalism.

title: China seeks 'impartial' probe into Pahalgam attack, backs Pakistan
content: China has called for an impartial probe into the Pahalgam terror attack, urging both India and Pakistan to exercise restraint amidst rising tensions. Foreign Minister Wang Yi conveyed China's support for Pakistan's security concerns and counter-terrorism efforts during a conversation with Pakistani counterpart Ishaq Dar. China hopes for de-escalation, emphasizing that conflict undermines regional peace and stability.

title: Musk replies to Vance's family photos from Taj Mahal: 'One of the ... '
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his family, recently visited the Taj Mahal during a four-day trip to India. Vance shared photos on X, with Elon Musk commenting on the monument's beauty. The family's visit included a warm welcome from Uttar Pradesh's Chief Minister and stringent security measures along their route.

title: 11 killed after SUV runs into crowd at Canada's Vancouver street festival
content: A tragic incident unfolded at the Lapu Lapu Day Block Party in Vancouver as a vehicle drove into the crowd, resulting in eleven fatalities and numerous injuries. The driver is in police custody, and investigations are underway.

title: Dhaka court's arrest warrant on Sheikh Hasina's daughter
content: A Dhaka court has issued an Interpol arrest warrant for Saima Wazed Putul, daughter of former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, concerning a plot allocation corruption case. The order, granted after an Anti-Corruption Commission request, follows previous arrest warrants issued against both Hasina and Wazed in connection with the same case.

title: IPL: Kohli anchors, Krunal attacks; RCB storm to top of the table
content: Virat Kohli's composed half-century and Krunal Pandya's explosive 73 not out propelled Royal Challengers Bengaluru to a six-wicket victory over Delhi Capitals. The home crowd passionately cheered for Kohli, who anchored the chase with a steady innings. Krunal's all-round performance, including crucial bowling figures, complemented Kohli's efforts, securing RCB's position at the top of the points table despite Axar Patel's early breakthroughs.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is not 'happy', says 'We should have been...'
content: Elon Musk expressed his disappointment that humans haven't reached Mars yet, despite SpaceX's efforts. He referenced the rapid progress from the first flight to the moon landing, highlighting the current delay in space exploration.

title: Should US-born children with cancer go with their deported immigrant parents?
content: The Trump administration faces criticism after deporting US-born children, including a toddler and a child with cancer, alongside their undocumented mothers to Honduras. A Trump-appointed judge questioned the legality of the deportations, citing concerns about due process and verifying the mother's consent. These actions have sparked outrage and raised concerns about the administration's broader immigration crackdown.

title: 'Closely following': China backs Pak, advocates 'impartial probe' into Pahalgam attack
content: China voices strong support for Pakistan, urging an impartial probe into the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 25 Indians and one Nepalese citizen. Wang Yi emphasized understanding Pakistan's security concerns amidst rising tensions with India, while the US President downplayed intervention. Meanwhile, India's NIA intensifies its investigation into the attack, aiming to uncover the conspiracy behind the tragic event.

title: J&K: Gunmen kill civilian in Valley's Kupwara
content: In north Kashmir's Kupwara district, unknown gunmen fatally shot a civilian, Ghulam Rasool Magray, during a power outage late Saturday. The incident occurred outside Magray's home in Kandi Khas, four days after a terrorist attack in Pahalgam. Authorities have registered a case and initiated an investigation into the killing, while political figures are demanding accountability.

title: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan announces layoffs: Read full letter sent to employees
content: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan announced a restructuring plan involving layoffs and management changes to regain competitiveness. The company aims to cut $1.5 billion in operating expenses over two years, focusing on engineering talent and streamlining processes. A return-to-office mandate of four days a week will also be implemented to foster collaboration and innovation.

title: Ensure innocent Kashmiris don’t bear brunt of war on terror: Omar, Mehbooba, Lone
content: Following the Pahalgam attack, Jammu and Kashmir leaders Omar Abdullah, Mehbooba Mufti, and Sajad Lone cautioned against collective punishment of Kashmiris during the crackdown on terrorists. They emphasized that while terrorism must be decisively fought, innocent people should not become collateral damage.

title: Liverpool clinch Premier League crown, equal record 20th English title
content: Liverpool clinched their 20th English title, equaling Manchester United's record, with a dominant 5-1 victory over Tottenham. Arne Slot's team secured the Premier League crown with four games to spare, sparking jubilant celebrations at Anfield. This triumph marks their second Premier League title and first in five years, a stark contrast to their previous win celebrated without fans.

title: Ex-members of banned JeI form new J&K political party
content: Former members of the banned Jamaat-e-Islami (JeI) Kashmir have launched a new political party called Jammu & Kashmir Justice and Development Front. The party aims to bridge the gap between governance and the grassroots level. Sayar Reshi, a former JeI member, stated the party will participate in all upcoming elections in the Valley.

title: J&K BJP MLAs assure border dwellers of their safety
content: Following the Pahalgam massacre and heightened border tensions with Pakistan, BJP MLAs Rajiv Jasrotia and Satish Bhagat visited villages in their respective J&K constituencies to reassure residents. Jasrotia emphasized the nation's unity and the government's commitment to their safety, while Bhagat affirmed the army's readiness to counter enemy threats.

title: IPL 2025 Points Table: Latest standings after DC vs RCB match
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru defeated Delhi Capitals by six wickets at the Arun Jaitley Stadium, securing the top spot in the IPL 2025 points table with 14 points. RCB's Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Josh Hazlewood restricted DC to 162/8. Despite an early wobble, Virat Kohli's 51 and Krunal Pandya's unbeaten 73 guided RCB to victory, with Tim David adding a quickfire 19*.

title: Standoff in UK: Indian diaspora counters Pakistani protesters over Pahalgam attack
content: Tensions flared in London as Indian and Pakistani diaspora groups clashed outside their respective high commissions, triggered by the Pahalgam attack. Demonstrators engaged in heated exchanges, with accusations of abuse leveled against Pakistani protestors. A significant police presence was required to maintain order after a previous day's confrontation and arrest for racial abuse, reflecting escalating tensions between India and Pakistan.

title: Virat Kohli roasted online for Patidar run-out during DC vs RCB
content: Virat Kohli faced criticism after a run-out mix-up with Rajat Patidar during the DC vs RCB IPL 2025 match, leading to Patidar's dismissal for 6. This incident occurred with RCB struggling at 26/3 while chasing 163, adding pressure after their bowlers had earlier restricted DC to 162/8, despite Stubbs' late hitting and Rahul's patient innings.

title: Trudeau to 51st state: How Trump Tariff-ied Canada into voting liberal
content: Donald Trump's return and aggressive trade policies, including tariffs on Canadian imports and annexation suggestions, dramatically reshaped Canada's political landscape. This external pressure propelled Liberal leader Mark Carney, emphasizing crisis management, ahead of Conservative Pierre Poilievre in the polls. The election became a referendum on leadership amid fears of US overreach, influencing voter behavior and potentially securing a Liberal victory.

title: What is responsible for water on the Moon? A new study reveals
content: In a groundbreaking discovery, NASA scientists suggest the Sun's solar wind might be a key factor in creating water on the Moon. Charged particles from the Sun interact with lunar soil, potentially forming hydroxyl and water molecules. Recreating this process in the lab using Apollo 17 lunar dust, researchers found evidence of water formation.

title: Pakistan diplomat’s throat-slitting gesture sparks London probe
content: The Metropolitan Police are investigating a throat-slitting gesture by a Pakistani diplomat towards Indian protesters in London, who were demonstrating against a terror attack. The Pakistani high commission organized a counter-protest, escalating tensions with loud music and provocative signs. Amidst the chaos, arrests were made, and Indian protesters felt unfairly targeted by the police, alleging biased treatment.

title: 'Has bulldozer lost its might?': Akhilesh after tires thrown at SP MP's convoy
content: Tires were thrown at Samajwadi Party MP Ramjilal Suman's convoy near Aligarh, allegedly by Karni Sena activists, leading to vehicle collisions. The incident occurred as Suman was en route to Bulandshahr to investigate reported atrocities against Dalits. Following the attack and subsequent police intervention, Suman was prevented from proceeding and sent back to Agra, prompting condemnation from Samajwadi Party leaders.

title: Rishabh Pant's woes deepen: Big fine after LSG's hammering by MI
content: Rishabh Pant's struggles deepened as Lucknow Super Giants suffered a heavy defeat to Mumbai Indians, compounded by a slow over-rate fine of Rs 24 lakh for Pant. His poor form with the bat continued, scoring only four runs during LSG's chase. Mumbai Indians, powered by Suryakumar Yadav and Jasprit Bumrah, secured their fifth consecutive win, leaving LSG's playoff hopes hanging.

title: Israel hits Hezbollah site in Beirut after warning residents to flee
content: Israeli fighter jets struck Beirut's southern suburbs, marking the third attack since a ceasefire. The strike targeted Hezbollah facilities after a warning, causing panic among residents. Lebanese President condemned the attack, urging international intervention to prevent regional destabilization. The UN also voiced concern, emphasizing the need to avoid undermining the fragile ceasefire.

title: 'Just about something clicking': Zaheer on Rishabh Pant's sorry run
content: Despite Rishabh Pant's struggles with the bat in IPL 2025, Lucknow Super Giants mentor Zaheer Khan strongly supports his leadership. Khan dismisses pressure from Pant's hefty price tag, emphasising his positive attitude and crucial role in the middle order. Zaheer remains confident that Pant will regain his form and lead the team effectively.

title: 'Let's find out who's culprit': Pak seeks Russia, China involvement in Pahalgam probe
content: Amidst escalating tensions following the Pahalgam terror attack, Pakistan's defence minister has urged Russia, China, and Western nations to form an international investigation team, questioning India's accusations and demanding concrete evidence.

title: 'Rancho’s School': Famous '3 Idiots' school in Ladakh gets CBSE nod after 20 years
content: Druk Padma Karpo School, famously known as "Rancho’s School" from the film 3 Idiots, has finally secured CBSE affiliation after a 20-year wait. Located in Ladakh, the school faced numerous delays and rejections from the JKBOSE despite its strong infrastructure and academic record.

title: 'Is your wife paid by ... ?': Assam CM Himanta vs Gaurav Gogoi fight turns ugly
content: Assam chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has raised questions about a Congress MP. Sarma inquired about the MP's visit to Pakistan. He also questioned the MP's wife's salary from a Pakistan-based NGO. Sarma further asked about the citizenship of the MP's wife and children. These allegations follow previous statements about a possible Interpol probe.

title: Pahalgam attack: 15 local cadres helped terrorists, probe reveals
content: Indian authorities have identified fifteen local Kashmiri overground workers (OGWs) as suspects in facilitating the recent Pahalgam terror attack. Electronic surveillance revealed their potential involvement in logistics and arms procurement from Pakistan. Three prime suspects are detained, with police seeking two others.

title: Mumbai Indians create history, become first IPL team to record ...
content: Mumbai Indians achieved a significant milestone in the Indian Premier League. They secured their 150th victory, a first in IPL history. Mumbai defeated Lucknow Super Giants by 54 runs. Suryakumar Yadav and Ryan Rickelton scored impressive fifties. Jasprit Bumrah's outstanding bowling performance further solidified Mumbai's win. This victory propelled Mumbai Indians to second place in the points table.

title: Tamil Nadu ministers Senthil Balaji, K Ponmudy quit MK Stalin's Cabinet
content: Tamil Nadu ministers Senthil Balaji and K Ponmudy have resigned from Chief Minister MK Stalin's Cabinet, as confirmed by Raj Bhavan. Governor TN Ravi accepted their resignations amidst legal challenges. Balaji faces scrutiny in the cash-for-jobs scam, while Ponmudy is under fire for alleged hate speech against religious groups and women.

title: 'I bowl when I am required': Mumbai Indians skipper makes a big revelation
content: Mumbai Indians secured a dominant 54-run victory against Lucknow Super Giants, fueled by attacking half-centuries from Ryan Rickelton and Suryakumar Yadav. Jasprit Bumrah's exceptional bowling, along with Trent Boult's impactful spells, restricted LSG to 161. Hardik Pandya explained his limited bowling role, emphasizing the opportunity given to debutant Corbin Bosch, as MI climbed to second in the standings.

title: Russia launches nearly 150 drones on Ukraine as Trump questions Putin
content: Overnight, Russia launched extensive drone and airstrike attacks across Ukraine, resulting in at least four fatalities and multiple injuries, as reported by Ukrainian officials. The attacks targeted regions including Kostyantynivka and Pavlohrad, causing significant damage and casualties. Amidst these events, Donald Trump expressed skepticism regarding Vladimir Putin's commitment to ending the war, hinting at potential further sanctions against Moscow.

title: Chewing or swallowing?: Best way to consume chia seeds for hair growth
content: Chia seeds, rich in omega-3s, protein, and minerals, are beneficial for hair health. To maximize nutrient absorption for hair growth, soaking chia seeds is the most effective method. Chewing is a decent alternative, but swallowing them whole is less beneficial. Consistency in consumption, along with a balanced diet and proper hair care, is crucial for optimal results.

title: Jasprit Bumrah's brilliance blows away Lucknow Super Giants
content: Jasprit Bumrah's exceptional bowling performance, claiming 4 for 22, propelled Mumbai Indians to a dominant victory over Lucknow Super Giants. Mumbai Indians, after being put into bat, posted a formidable 215 for 7, fueled by Ishan Kishan's 58 and Suryakumar Yadav's 54.

title: Sanjiv Goenka memes flood internet again after Pant flop show
content: Rishabh Pant faced another setback against Mumbai Indians. He scored only four runs. His struggles led to memes featuring Sanjiv Goenka. Mumbai Indians posted a strong total of 215/7. Ryan Rickelton and Suryakumar Yadav hit half-centuries. Lucknow Super Giants bowlers struggled. Mayank Yadav and Avesh Khan took two wickets each.

title: 'You do not ask murderer to investigate his own murders': Tharoor on Pak PM’s call for 'probe' into Pahalgam attack
content: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor rejected Pakistan's call for a probe into the Pahalgam terror attack, emphasizing Pakistan cannot investigate its own alleged crimes. He acknowledged security lapses but urged focusing on the larger picture, drawing parallels with Israel's intelligence failure on October 7. Tharoor also expressed concern over the human cost of strained India-Pakistan relations due to cross-border terrorism.

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in . an elderly tribesman was killed in an elephant .

title: Doctor, 25, Goes To Delhi For Exam, Suffers Burn Injuries In Haryana, Dies
content: A 25-year-old medical graduate, Bhawana Yadav, from Rajasthan preparing for postgraduate medical studies in Delhi suffered severe burn injuries while she was in Hisar. She later died during treatment in Jaipur.

title: Zero Tolerance For Terrorism: S Jaishankar To UK Counterpart Over Pahalgam
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Sunday conveyed to his British counterpart David Lammy India's policy of "zero tolerance" for terrorism while discussing the "cross-border" links to the dastardly terror attack in Pahalgam.

title: Man Accused Of Rape Marries Survivor In Odisha Jail
content: A 26-year-old man lodged in a jail in Odisha's Ganjam district in a rape case, on Sunday married the survivor in the premises of the prison, officials said.

title: Cheetah Nirva Gives Birth To 5 Cubs At Kuno National Park In Madhya Pradesh
content: Cheetah Nirva has given birth to five cubs at Kuno National Park in Madhya Pradesh, announced Chief Minister Mohan Yadav on Sunday.

title: 11 Dead As Van Plunges In Well After Hitting Bike In Madhya Pradesh: Cops
content: A speeding van plunged into a water-filled well after hitting a bike in Madhya Pradesh's Mandsaur district on Sunday, leaving 11 persons, including a biker and a rescuer, dead, police said.

title: "No Terror Link": Canada Cops On Vancouver Car Rampage That Killed 11
content: Canadian police have detained a 30-year-old man after a car rammed into a street party during a Filipino cultural celebration in Vancouver on Saturday, killing at least eleven people.

title: "No One There": Pak Woman Living In India For 35 Years Told To Go Back
content: Sarada Bai, a Pakistani national, who has been living in India for over since 35 years, has been asked by the Odisha police to leave India immediately.

title: BJP Expels Ex-Rajasthan MLA From Party Amid Temple Purification Row
content: The ruling BJP in Rajasthan on Sunday expelled its former MLA Gyan Dev Ahuja, who was recently at the centre of temple "purification" controversy, from primary membership of the party.

title: Consider Action Against Bangladesh Along With Pak: Himanta Sarma To Centre
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Sunday said India should take tough action against Bangladesh also along with Pakistan.

title: Congress MP And MLA Allege Mob Attack In Assam
content: Ahead of the panchayat election in Assam in May first week, Congress leader and Lok Sabha MP Pradyut Bordoloi was attacked by some people in black clothes in Nagaon district's Dhing.

title: 40 Dead, Over 1,000 Injured In Iran Port Fire, Blast Heard 50 Km Away: 10 Points
content: Smoke shrouded Iran's largest commercial port and surrounding areas as a fire following a major blast killed 40 people and injured more than 1,000 so far. Strong winds posed hindrances to firefighting operations.

title: Religious Hate Has No Place In France: Macron After Muslim Killed In Mosque
content: There can never be a place for racism and hate in France, President Emmanuel Macron said on Sunday after the brutal stabbing to death of a Muslim in a mosque in the south of the country.

title: Telangana Transfers IAS Officer Who Reshared AI Image In Hyderabad Land Row
content: Senior IAS officer Smita Sabharwal, who was recently summoned by the police for reposting an AI-generated Ghibli image on social media regarding the cutting of trees on 400-acre land near Hyderabad Central University, is among 20 officers transferred

title: Highlights: High-Level Meet On Pahalgam Attack Amid India-Pak Tensions
content: Pahalgam terror attack updates: Tensions between India and Pakistan have soared after a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir left 26 people dead this week.

title: Tamil Nadu Ministers Senthil Balaji, K Ponmudy Resign From State Cabinet
content: Tamil Nadu Ministers V Senthil Balaji and K Ponmudy have resigned from the M K Stalin-led state cabinet and the Governor has accepted the same, the Raj Bhavan said on Sunday.

title: Woman Kidnapped By Auto Driver, Gang-Raped, Stabbed In Odisha: Cops
content: A woman was allegedly kidnapped by the driver of an auto-rickshaw, which she hailed while returning home from work, gang-raped and then stabbed multiple times, police said.

title: Wife Of BSF Jawan Detained By Pakistan To Visit Punjab To Seek Release Details
content: The wife of BSF jawan Purnam Sahu - detained by Pakistan Rangers after inadvertently crossing the international border - said she would visit Ferozepur in Punjab to gather information from senior officials of the force about efforts to bring him back

title: Pak Army Says Killed 54 Militants Trying To Cross Border From Afghanistan
content: Pakistan's army said Sunday its soldiers killed 54 militants who had tried to enter the country by crossing its northwestern border with Afghanistan.

title: Shashi Tharoor Reacts To Bilawal Bhutto's "Blood Will Flow" Remark
content: The nation has been demanding military action against Pakistan after the Pahalgam terror attack, and some visible military response is unavoidable, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has said.

title: China Closely Following "Evolving India-Pakistan Situation": State Media
content: China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi in a phone call with his Pakistani counterpart Mohammad Ishaq Dar on Sunday said his country is closely following the situation between India and Pakistan, China's state media Global Times said in a report.

title: ‘Adverse information’ claims by USCIS trigger alarm bells for attorneys and H-1B community
content: Lubna Kably is a senior editor, who focuses on various policies and legislation. In particular, she writes extensively on immigration and tax policies. The Indian diaspora is the largest in the world; through her articles she demystifies the immigration-policy related developments in select countries for outbound students, job aspirants and employees. She also analyses the impact of Income-tax and GST related developments for individuals and business entities. title: 6-team mock draft: How early did Paige Bueckers go?
content: the 2025 WNBA season is set to tip off on may 16, the ESPN experts came together for a fantasy women's basketball mock draft . we used the default settings -- a six-team league with nine players per team and the following scoring system . the participants of this mock draft were Charlie Creme, Eric Moody, Jason Shebilske, andre Snellings .

title: Draft overreactions on Sanders, Cousins, Giants, Jags and Steelers
content: the 2025 draft featured an entire sub-industry of overreaction around one particular player who ended up being the 144th pick by the Browns . the discourse was on fire when the second and third rounds ended Friday night and Sanders still hadn't been drafted .

title: Eastern Conference playoffs: Knicks take 3-1 lead over Pistons
content: a controversial no-call on Tim Hardaway Jr.'s three-point attempt results in the Knicks narrowly winning Game 4 over the Pistons . the Cleveland Cavaliers took a commanding 3-0 lead over the Miami Heat on Saturday without Darius Garland, handing the Heat their worst-ever playoff loss .

title: Transfer portal's lure involves more than just a big payday for players
content: Clayton Powell-Lee has spent the past month searching for an answer . he can build on his 53 tackles last season, after which he landed a six-figure name, image and likeness contract with the school . the market for defensive backs is booming, his agents say .

title: Lions sixth-round pick Ahmed Hassanein proposes to girlfriend after being drafted
content: Ahmed Hassanei is now the first Egyptian to be drafted into the NFL . the former boise State Broncos pass rusher proposed to his girlfriend . he was drafted by the nfl in the 2025 draft .

title: How Liverpool won the 2024-25 Premier League, in pictures
content: the reds have clinched the 2024-25 premier league title, their first since 2020-21 and their first under new manager Arne Slot . the club have 24 wins and just two defeats in 33 matches, with four games remaining . this season, there were plenty of dramatic moments along the way to july .
